criteria: Understanding of Safe Physical Activity Guidelines
Ability to Identify Safe Physical Activities
descriptions: Does not demonstrate understanding of physical activity guidelines.
Demonstrates minimal understanding of physical activity guidelines.
Identifies some physical activity guidelines with limited accuracy.
Identifies several physical activity guidelines with reasonable accuracy.
Clearly identifies and explains multiple physical activity guidelines accurately.
Thoroughly explains and applies physical activity guidelines, demonstrating a comprehensive understanding.
Unable to identify any safe physical activities.
Identifies one or two activities, but safety concerns are not addressed.
Identifies a few activities with vague references to safety.
Identifies several activities and mentions some relevant safety considerations.
Identifies numerous activities with clear and accurate safety explanations.
Provides a wide range of activities with comprehensive safety analysis and risk mitigation strategies.
Does not mention any safety measures related to physical activity.
Mentions one or two basic safety measures with little detail.
Suggests a few safety measures but lacks specific application to activities.
Describes several relevant safety measures and their application to specific activities.
Explains and applies safety measures effectively, showing a clear understanding of their importance.
Critically evaluates and adapts safety measures for various activities, considering individual needs and environmental factors.
